captions.text: I hate this! I hate this so much.

This is the worst thing
I've ever done for BuzzFeed.

All I know about threading
is it looks like floss.
- I know that there's some string.
I don't know. What goes on?
- Hopefully I won't even notice it.
- Well, I want the to look even.
- I go, get it down more.

- Okay, and that is just like
normal, like, sewing thread?
we gonna remove your hair with the thread.
- I will say that there are...

many other things I'd
rather be doing than this.

I don't know, being
punched in the stomach.

- The middle, like the
area she's doing now,
is actually not painful at all.
A little bit? Okay, that's fine.
- I didn't even volunteer for this video.
Gabby volunteered me for this video.

- Note to self, don't
wear make-up next time.
I look a little less Greek.

- It felt like all my
eyebrows would be gone.

- The girls, they're used
to waxing and everything,
they're so much tougher than me.
- Yeah, I would bring a police officer or
If I were to do this again.
- I don't think I could ever get

I'm happy that I have
unfleek eyebrows, yes.

title: People Try Threading For The First Time

comments.text:
This is what some fifth graders have to go through to fit in and the adult 
boys are screaming in pain. Funny how that works :3﻿
comments.author: zelda hylian

comments.text:
"Gaby volunteered for me"
oh god﻿
comments.author: April MayMa

comments.text: try doing that on a regular basis! Which I sorta do... like every 2 months﻿
comments.author: Kayla McKinnon

comments.text:
I have a very low pain tolerance and threading wasn't bad at all.
﻿
comments.author: Jones Jones

comments.text: "Is there a...seatbelt?"﻿
comments.author: Trinity Hope

comments.text:
If your skin ever turns red or breaks out because of waxing, due threading. 
It does take a little longer but you get a nicer shape, no redness (maybe a 
little), and generally no break outs. If you haven't gotten your eyebrows 
done in a long time it will obviously hurt because you have more hair to 
take out. If your skin is sensitive then it'll also hurt. The guys in the 
video really did overreact- it's not that bad ;)﻿
comments.author: Alexandria Faber

comments.text: 2:15 her eyebrows were perfect﻿
comments.author: zeeshan 110

comments.text:
the only way I've ever done my eyebrows is threading. First time was by far 
the most painful experience now I barely notice. ﻿
comments.author: Shaiyena Cepeda

comments.text: I felt the pain.﻿
comments.author: Serena Mallavarapu

comments.text: I'm sorry but dang that first girl is not attractive in anyway sheesh ﻿
comments.author: Jordan Clark

comments.text: She should put some rose water on them! The burning will go away :)﻿
comments.author: Sahana Gururaj

comments.text: Threading does hurt a little. ﻿
comments.author: Siri De Leon

comments.text:
I've always had my eyebrows threaded. I don't think it hurts that much.. 
but lips on the other hand.. Wow and ow..

One day while getting my brows done the woman 'helpfully' said "Can I do 
your top lip for you?" I replied with "No thanks" (because everyone knows 
that having your top lip threaded hurts like childbirth on the face..)

She replied, "You should let me do it.. your lip is very hairy"
Me: "Errmmmm no thanks, I'm good.."
Her "You sure? It really is very VERY hairy"

I left quickly and quietly and very red faced... When I got home I was 
telling my daughter what had happened. She laughed and my son (who was 
listening) said...

"Mum, I mustache you a question.. Why did you not get your hairy lip done?"﻿
comments.author: Lyca31

comments.text: Am such a baby lol﻿
comments.author: feel good

comments.text:
I have thick eyebrows and in India most places dont wax. Threading is the 
most painful thing ever. I was like how hard could it be but imagine 
someone literally plucking your hair out one by one. Urgg. I tear up most 
times lol﻿
comments.author: Prachi Rungta

comments.text: Hahaha hah 😂 !are you whipping blood off?"﻿

comments.text:
had my eyebrows threaded yesterday. What i can say about it is that it hurt

comments.text: FLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!﻿
comments.author: mmmkeklol

comments.text:
I had my eyebrows and my lady mustache done in the Middle East and it was 
the best job ever. It hurts but I did not wax for about 6 months. As long 
it is a job well done, it's worth the pain. Now... I am kinds private with 
these things so getting it done in the middle of the mall... no thanks.﻿

Threading is so worth it! It doesn't irritate the skin as much as waxing so

comments.author: Maxine Ramsdell

comments.text:
I have been threading my eyebrows for almost three years. Now I am 
completely used to it but I remember the first time it didn't hurt but 
oddly the second time it did. The worst thing that I still do is I feel 
like I want to sneeze and when the lady stops the sneeze is gone! That's 
the worst feeling ever!﻿
comments.author: N.42

comments.text:
I have done tweezing, waxing, and threading and by far threading has the 
nicest results and no more painful than the others. And I have been to 
different places, different threaders. For me it's not that bad, but I have 
a high pain tolerance ..I enjoy tattoos.
My daughter actually likes getting her eyebrows threaded...lol.﻿
comments.author: Jody Baer-Swanson

comments.text:
So it's just the same as tweezing, only they are using thread to pull the 
hair out instead of a tweezer.﻿
comments.author: coffeeNcreambaby

comments.text:
I get my eyebrows threaded everytime, instead of wax. It's a lot more 
painful but it takes about two or three weeks for hair to start growing 
back. It's worth it. They always look amazing﻿

comments.text:
This is how we do our eyebrows in most of Arabic countries . and I still

comments.text: they all look so much better after!﻿
comments.author: Matthew Lastnames

comments.text:
Threading only really hurts the first time and it's uncomfortable if you 
haven't done it in a long time. If you find a good threader it shouldn't 
hurt again once you've got it done before. Some threaders are too hard and 
aggressive. But for me waxing is super painful. I have very thin skin and 
have been burned and scarred from waxing. Never again!!!! Threading only 
for me baby.﻿

comments.text: The girl with the lip ring knew better ! 😒﻿

omg the guy is so ridiculous, ive done it and it doesn't hurt at all lol.

Threading is practiced in most of the salons in sri Lanka and I believe

i've had my eyebrows threaded and they didn't hurt THAT bad, i mean it hurt

comments.author: Cammie Reeves (beautybycammie7)

comments.text:
I always thought I had a low tolerance of pain (which I probably do.) but 
I'm reading all of these comments and people are saying how badly painful 
threading really is, while when I had mine threaded it was painful a little 
yes, but I literally just sat their silently, like I could bare it and I 
would have them done again because it makes UR brows so clean it's worth 
it.﻿
comments.author: Troy Bolton

comments.text: I prefer threading than waxing ﻿
comments.author: Leydi Vasquez

comments.text:
The first time i got my eyebrows done, it was threading and I must honestly 
say... It did not hurt at all!! Now I've tried waxing and plucking, and i 
still prefer threading. The place that i went to used to be a kiosk at the 
mall so i didn't have very high hopes but i was amazed. I felt a little bit 
of a burn but not much to complain about. Plus my eyebrows looked soooo 
good!!﻿

comments.text: 0:16 i really hope those glasses are a joke!﻿

comments.text:
That one guys was a wimp.  I've been doing threading for years best thing

redness goes away in a couple of hours because they are only pulling the 
hair and not the skin.  The last time I waxed the area was swollen for 3 
days, never again.﻿
